content.description:
YOULL NEVER COME BACK 5.7 + * (PG13) (80') G

A committing gear route (with some tricky placements) up the diagonal seam right of Rites of Passage. Begin about 20' right of that route and climb through the high crux mantle to share the top chains with it. Tiny to large gear needed (some small to medium cams are essential).
content.protection: Wide range of cams - double in the medium small range
content.location: The diagonal line up the slab at the far left end of the South Wall

content.description:
THIRSTY MOON 5.6 ** 80' M (3b)

Begin as for Rites of Passage but continue up the corner. Traverse right to share the chain anchors near the top. Needs a few medium to large cams to protect.
content.protection: Mixed - 3 bolts and some cams (medium to large)
content.location: At the furthest south (left) end of the Lower Crag.

content.description:
Rites of Passage 5.8 *** 75' F(5b)

On the low-angled first cliff on the left, climb the left side to the chain anchors near the top. Sustained high quality progressively harder face climbing. The top 15' is runout 5.2 or so, protectable by a medium cam if need be.
content.location: Climbs the left side of the first cliff on the left when approaching The Far South from the south.

content.description:
Pandora's Box 5.7+ *** (80') G

Begin in the narrow corner/chimney at the left side of the face to the left of the main corner at the start of the South Wall. Climb through the lower crux then exit the corner to the right and head up the easier face to the chain anchors over the top.
content.protection: Gear - a wide range of cams and nuts (including several large ones), plus several l draws to reduce rope drag.
content.location: On the left side the of the lower left wall, beginning in the narrow corner.

content.description:
LOW HANGING FRUIT 5.6 * 70' M (3b)

Begin at the base of Youll Never Come Back but head up the face above. A bolt protected crux between gear protected lower and upper sections leads to the 2 chain anchors on top.
content.protection: Mixed, 3 bolts and some cams (small to large)
content.location: On the right side slabby face at the south end of the South Wall

content.description:
Lone Pine 5.10a ** (60') M(4b)

Climbs a direct line below the pine tree on the upper south face. Begin about 10' left of the start of Snake Dike and end at the bolt/ring anchors above the ledge beside the pine. A sustained and strenuous route, with the bottom 2/3rds gear protected (a range of small to large cams), with a bolt protected crux above.
content.protection: Mixed - 4 bolts plus several small to large cams needed on first half.
content.location: Climbs the middle of the upper south face. Best approach is up the deer trail at the mouth of the canyon.

content.description:
FLY AGARIC 5.8 ** (75') M (5b)

Climbs the far right side of the short South Wall (just left of the big corner of the South Wall). Start by stemming up the corner until its possible to step left onto the wonderfully featured face. Some medium to large cams are needed before and after the bolt protected crux. Chains in the corner on top.
content.protection: Mixed - 5 bolts and several medium to large cams.
content.location: At the far right of the South Wall, beginning at the base of the main corner.

content.description:
Eleusinian Fields 5.9 **** (80') M(3b)

Climbs the middle of the shorter face to the left of the main large corner of the South Wall. A pumpy gear protected crux leads to an easier bolt protected upper section, with a tricky finish to the pair of (red) chain anchors on top. Excellent climbing on excellent rock with an abundance of jugs and pockets needs a double set of medium to large cams to protect.
content.protection: Mixed - 3 bolts plus a range of medium to small cams and some long draws to reduce rope drag.
content.location: In the middle of the face left of the main corner.

content.description:
THE ALCHEMY OF ECSTASY 5.7 ** (80') M (2b)

Climbs the right ride of the arete at the far left end of the South Wall. Begin in the crack, when it ends climb the arete on the left, then traverse right to finish on the bolt protected upper face with the chain anchors on top. A range of medium cams and nuts are needed to protect this fun and highly featured route.
content.protection: Mixed, 2 bolts and a range of medium cams
content.location: On the arete at the left end of the South Wall

content.description:
STRANGE FRUIT 5.9- ** 80' M (3b)

Climbs the slanted corner at the right side of the face. Begin in the corner (bouldery start) leads to sustained and interesting (even odd) gear protected moves to the high bolt protected crux. The final 20+ feet are a 5.0 scramble up to the top chains which it shares with the other fruit route.
content.protection: Mixed, 3 bolts and several tiny cams as well several small to medium ones.
content.location: At the far right side of the first slabby face (climbs the leaning corner).
